info.title: Amazon RDS Events API
info.description: The API for managing Amazon RDS Eventss

get.summary: Creates an RDS event notification subscription.
get.description: Creates an RDS event notification subscription.

parameters.name: Enabled
parameters.description: A Boolean value; set to true to activate the subscription, set to false to create the subscription but not active it.

parameters.name: EventCategories.member.N
parameters.description: A list of event categories for a SourceType that you want to subscribe to. You can see a list of the categories for a given SourceType             in the Events topic in the Amazon RDS User Guide              or by using the DescribeEventCategories action.

parameters.name: SnsTopicArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic created for event notification. The ARN is created by Amazon SNS when you create             a topic and subscribe to it.

parameters.name: SourceIds.member.N
parameters.description: The list of identifiers of the event sources for which events will be returned. If not specified,            then all sources are included in the response. An identifier must begin with a letter and must contain only             ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens; it cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.

parameters.name: SourceType
parameters.description: The type of source that will be generating the events. For example, if you want to be notified of events generated by a DB instance,             you would set this parameter to db-instance. if this value is not specified, all events are returned.

parameters.name: SubscriptionName
parameters.description: The name of the subscription.

parameters.name: Tags.member.N
parameters.description: A list of tags.

get.summary: Deletes an RDS event notification subscription.
get.description: Deletes an RDS event notification subscription.

parameters.name: SubscriptionName
parameters.description: The name of the RDS event notification subscription you want to delete.

get.summary: Displays a list of categories for all event source types, or, if specified, for a specified source type.
get.description: Displays a list of categories for all event source types, or, if specified, for a specified source type.

parameters.name: Filters.member.N
parameters.description: This parameter is not currently supported.

parameters.name: SourceType
parameters.description: The type of source that will be generating the events.

get.summary: Returns events related to DB instances, DB security groups, DB snapshots, and DB parametern        groups for the past 14 days.
get.description: Returns events related to DB instances, DB security groups, DB snapshots, and DB parametern        groups for the past 14 days.

parameters.name: Duration
parameters.description: The number of minutes to retrieve events for.

parameters.name: EndTime
parameters.description: The end of the time interval for which to retrieve events,        specified in ISO 8601 format. For more information about ISO 8601,         go to the ISO8601 Wikipedia page.

parameters.name: EventCategories.member.N
parameters.description: A list of event categories that trigger notifications for a event notification subscription.

parameters.name: Filters.member.N
parameters.description: This parameter is not currently supported.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous        DescribeEvents request.        If this parameter is specified, the response includes        only records beyond the marker,        up to the value specified by MaxRecords.

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to include in the response.        If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value,            a pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that the remaining        results can be retrieved.

parameters.name: SourceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the event source for which events        will be returned. If not specified,        then all sources are included in the response.

parameters.name: SourceType
parameters.description: The event source to retrieve events for.        If no value is specified, all events are returned.

parameters.name: StartTime
parameters.description: The beginning of the time interval to retrieve events for,        specified in ISO 8601 format. For more information about ISO 8601,         go to the ISO8601 Wikipedia page.

get.summary: Lists all the subscription descriptions for a customer account.
get.description: Lists all the subscription descriptions for a customer account.

parameters.name: Filters.member.N
parameters.description: This parameter is not currently supported.

parameters.name: Marker
parameters.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous            DescribeOrderableDBInstanceOptions request.            If this parameter is specified, the response includes            only records beyond the marker,            up to the value specified by MaxRecords .

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to include in the response.            If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value,            a pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that the remaining            results can be retrieved.

parameters.name: SubscriptionName
parameters.description: The name of the RDS event notification subscription you want to describe.

get.summary: Modifies an existing RDS event notification subscription.
get.description: Modifies an existing RDS event notification subscription.

parameters.name: Enabled
parameters.description: A Boolean value; set to true to activate the subscription.

parameters.name: EventCategories.member.N
parameters.description: A list of event categories for a SourceType that you want to subscribe to. You can see a list of the categories for a given SourceType             in the Events topic in the Amazon RDS User Guide              or by using the DescribeEventCategories action.

parameters.name: SnsTopicArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic created for event notification. The ARN is created by Amazon SNS when you create             a topic and subscribe to it.

parameters.name: SourceType
parameters.description: The type of source that will be generating the events. For example, if you want to be notified of events generated by a DB instance,             you would set this parameter to db-instance. if this value is not specified, all events are returned.

parameters.name: SubscriptionName
parameters.description: The name of the RDS event notification subscription.
